title: External routes failing on `sync` or `build`

labels.name: p3-edge-case
labels.description: SvelteKit cannot be used in an uncommon way

body:
### Describe the bug

I have monorepo, where I have template that has dynamic routing that feeds all my apps. 

so each app in svelte.config.js has `files.routes: '../../template/src/routes'`

Now with above config I get, after install on `svelte-kit  sync` 
`ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/home/user/monorepo/apps/core/.svelte-kit/types/route_meta_data.json'` 

So I figured that't because the routes can't be not inside app directory so changed it to 
``files.routes: 'node_modules/template/src/routes'`` 
Since my `template` package is symlinked in node_modules inside app directory

So now sync worked, but  after migration to latest svelte-kit, build fails because in vite manifest those routes resolve to `../../template/src/routes/...` and when build tries to find it in vite manifest it searches for `node_modules/template/src/routes` therefore it can't find it. 

so going back to first example, build works, but sync fails. 

So... how can I make both work ? 

### Reproduction

Have an app with routes referenced from outside of the project
